Your project is in the User Acceptance Testing phase and the customer comes back with a new requirement. What is correct sequence of activities in handling this change request:
Main.OPTION1: PM approves the Change, Change is implemented,CR is recorded in the CCR,CCB approves the recorded CR.
Main.OPTION2: Log the CR in the CCR, The CR is taken up by the CCB for impact analysis, PM approves the change, Change is implemented
Main.OPTION3: CCB approves the Change, PM does Impact analysis, Change is implemented, CR is recorded in the CCR
Main.OPTION4: Change is recorded in the CCR, Impact analysis is done by the CCB, Change is approved by the CCB, Change is implemented
Main.ANSWER: Log the CR in the CCR, The CR is taken up by the CCB for impact analysis, PM approves the change, Change is implemented

Main.QUESTION: Which of the following statements is INCORRECT?
Main.OPTION1: A workspace can originate from a preserved configuration of another workspace
Main.OPTION2: A workspace can originate from a repository
Main.OPTION3: A workspace originates from a bound configuration in the repository
Main.OPTION4: Maintaining a file system as work area is more space efficient than using a workspace
Main.ANSWER: Maintaining a file system as work area is more space efficient than using a workspace

Main.OPTION4: Control of Design and development Changes

Main.OPTION1: Build customized versions of project for different clients
Main.OPTION2: Merging two versions of the same file
Main.ANSWER: Build customized versions of project for different clients

Main.QUESTION: If a SCM break downs, which of the following is of the most help:
Main.OPTION1: The last complete backup of SCM repository
Main.OPTION2: Team coordination & proper project management in crisis
Main.OPTION3: Individual developer’s knowledge and understanding of the system developed so far
Main.ANSWER: The last complete backup of SCM repository

Main.OPTION3: Difference between two versions of ASCII files
Main.ANSWER: Difference between two versions of ASCII files

Main.QUESTION: In a parallel maintenance and enhancement project scenario if one of the bug fixes from maintenance project line is also need to be fixed for the enhancement project line then which of the following option is the most optimum?
Main.OPTION1: Suggesting developer of enhancement line to perform the bug fix changes
Main.OPTION2: Performing merge from identified baseline of maintenance bug fix to enhancement line
Main.OPTION3: Setting up trigger for automatic bug fix notification
Main.OPTION4: Inform testing team about the bug fix in enhancement line
Main.ANSWER: Performing merge from identified baseline of maintenance bug fix to enhancement line

Main.QUESTION: To ensure change control, Veloci-Q procedures says:
Main.OPTION1: The request of change should be recorded in Change Control Register
Main.OPTION2: Impact should be determined and client’s agreement should be received for payment against change incorporation
Main.OPTION3: Change should be tracked till it is PM approves it
Main.OPTION4: Risk assessment should be done in the end
Main.ANSWER: The request of change should be recorded in Change Control Register

Main.QUESTION: What is the correct definition of a Test Script?

Main.QUESTION: Which of the following could be a criteria to stop review

Main.OPTION3: Defects are rectified and verified by review team leader

Main.QUESTION: Which of the following statement is INCORRECT?
Main.OPTION1: The potential of testing to improve quality is unlimited.
Main.OPTION2: Properly run unit testing is potentially capable of removing 70% of the defects
Main.OPTION3: Testing cannot remove all defects which are undetected in earlier stages
Main.ANSWER: The potential of testing to improve quality is unlimited.

Main.QUESTION: Which of the following templates are related to reviews in veloci-Q?
Why is multiple rounds of system testing recommended?
Main.OPTION1: Accommodate bug fixes and eliminate maximum defects
Main.OPTION2: Shortage of resources to complete testing in one round
Main.OPTION3: Set of test cases can be executed in each round.
Main.OPTION4: For testing basic requirement, implied requirements , performance measures in various rounds
Main.ANSWER: Accommodate bug fixes and eliminate maximum defects

________ determines if a new software version is performing well enough to accept it for a major testing effort.
________ involves checking that each feature specified in the component design has been implemented in the component.
________ involves testing two or more modules together with the intent of finding defects between the modules.
________ is a method for determining if a set of test data or test cases is useful.
________ is done with the intent of determining how quickly a product handles a variety of events, actions or functions.
________ is the process of evaluating a system to verify that it satisfies specified requirements.
________ is used to test operation of the software and input-output data to ensure that the software is performing well.
________ techniques examine input and output of test data and derive test cases based on an analysis of the input and output domains.
________ typically involves reviews and meetings to evaluate documents, plans, code, requirements and specifications.
_________ can be done with checklists, issues lists, walkthroughs, and inspection meetings.
_________ determines how well a product performs when a load is placed on the system resources that nears and then exceeds the system capacity.
_________ is a document that defines the input, action and the corresponding expected output, to determine if a certain feature of an application is working correctly.
_________ refers to 'Are we building the RIGHT product?'
__________ implies testing the system with the intent of confirming the readiness of the product and customer acceptance of the product.
__________ is used to test system data and examine system output.
__________ refers to testing the features/ navigation/ expected expectations, when more than one users from different machines operate on same Objects.
